bibl.title: On the Meaning of the Term "nauteia" in the Papyri.
Proceedings of the XVIII International Congress of Papyrology. II
bibl.author: Gofas, Dimitri C.

bibl.note: "Nauteia" is a collective term indicating the persons serving on a ship, just like "pleroma". It could have been a local term, not used outside Egypt.
Gofas Dimitri C., On the Meaning of the Term "nauteia" in the Papyri.
Proceedings of the XVIII International Congress of Papyrology. II (Athens, 1988) pp. 255-260.
